private_information: I can only manipulate vowel-labeled blocks: A, E, I
I can pick up or put down exactly one top block at a time
I can only interact with blocks that are at the top of a stack
vowel_agent.goal: Collaborate to achieve the target tower configuration while only moving vowel blocks when needed.

private_information: I can only manipulate consonant-labeled blocks: B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L
I can pick up or put down exactly one top block at a time
I can only interact with blocks that are at the top of a stack
consonant_agent.goal: Collaborate to achieve the target tower configuration while only moving consonant blocks when needed.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' local analyses and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that yields a valid multi-agent plan to reach the global goal.

public_information: There are twelve uniquely labeled blocks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L.
Rules: Agents may only move blocks that are currently at the top of a stack; each move involves a single top block; only one block is moved at a time.
One agent can manipulate only vowel-labeled blocks (A, E, I). The other agent can manipulate only consonant-labeled blocks (B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L).
Initial stacks on the table (each list is bottom-to-top): Stack1: [B, E, L]; Stack2: [C, F, J, A]; Stack3: [D, G, K]; Stack4: [I, H].
Goal stack on the table (bottom-to-top): [L, K, J, I, H, G, F, E, D, C, B, A].

analysis.system_prompt: You are the vowel agent. Explain your capabilities, constraints, and produce a clear local description of allowed actions and example move sequences you can perform given only your knowledge. Do not output PDDL. Provide structured information that an orchestrator can use to build a PDDL model and to integrate with a partner agent.
analysis.prompt: You are named vowel_agent. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. Your objective is {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Describe the action schema you can execute in operational terms (for example, pick_up_vowel(block, from), put_down_vowel(block, to)), list preconditions and effects in plain structured form, and provide any local plan fragments or constraints (e.g., which vowel moves enable which consonant moves). If you are missing information, state what is missing rather than making assumptions. Output should help the orchestrator compose the final PDDL.

analysis.system_prompt: You are the consonant agent. Explain your capabilities, constraints, and produce a clear local description of allowed actions and example move sequences you can perform given only your knowledge. Do not output PDDL. Provide structured information that an orchestrator can use to build a PDDL model and to integrate with a partner agent.
analysis.prompt: You are named consonant_agent. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Your objective is {agents->consonant_agent->goal}. Describe the action schema you can execute in operational terms (for example, pick_up_consonant(block, from), put_down_consonant(block, to)), list preconditions and effects in plain structured form, and provide any local plan fragments or constraints (e.g., which consonant moves require vowels to first move). If you are missing information, state what is missing rather than making assumptions. Output should help the orchestrator compose the final PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and in preparing planning problems for the FastDownwards solver. Integrate the analyses from the agents and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that encodes the multi-agent constraints. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure agent actions remain distinct by prefixing or namespacing actions (for example, vowel_pick, consonant_pick). The domain must be compatible with FastDownwards conventions.
pddl.prompt: You are named orchestrator. Your overall task is {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Use the global public information {environment->public_information}, the vowel agent analysis {vowel_agent_analysis}, and the consonant agent analysis {consonant_agent_analysis}. Produce a unified PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownwards that represents objects, initial state, goal state, predicates, and separate action schemas for the vowel agent and the consonant agent. Keep actions distinct for each agent, represent the top-of-stack constraint, single-block move constraint, and agents' restricted manipulation sets. If any agent analysis is partial or ambiguous, resolve ambiguities explicitly and document any assumptions inside comments in the PDDL problem or as plain text preceding the PDDL blocks. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
